{{For|a defunct programming block on [[France 3]]|Le Disney Channel}} {{Infobox TV channel | name = Disney Channel | logofile = Disney Channel wordmark.svg | logosize = 200px | logoalt = | logo2 = | launch = [[22 March]] [[1997]] | closed date = | picture format = [[576i]] ([[SDTV]])

[[Belgium]]
[[Luxembourg]]
[[Switzerland]] | headquarters = | former names = | replaced names = | sister names = | timeshift names = Disney Channel +1 | web = | terr serv 1 = | terr chan 1 = | sat serv 1 = [[CanalSat]] | sat chan 1 = Channel 123 (HD), Channel 136 (+1) | cable serv 1 = [[Numericable]] | cable chan 1 = | adsl serv 1 = [[Freebox]] | adsl serv 2 = [[SFR | Neufbox]] | adsl serv 3 = [[Orange (telecommunications) | Livebox]] | adsl serv 4 = [[Bouygues Telecom | Bbox]] | adsl chan 1 = Channel 23, Channel 24 (+1) | adsl chan 2 = Channel 23, Channel 24 (+1) | adsl chan 3 = Channel 61, Channel 62 (+1) | adsl chan 4 = Channel 100, Channel 101 (+1) }} '''Disney Channel''' ''(or Disney Channel France)'' is the [[French language]] edition of the [[Disney Channel]], owned by the [[Walt Disney Company]]. It was launched in March 1997, primarily on the [[CanalSat]] platform. On November 2, 2000, the portfolio of Disney-branded channels in France expanded from one to four channel with the launch of Toon Disney, Playhouse Disney (now Disney Junior), and Disney Channel +1. The movie channel [[Disney Cinemagic]] and its accompanying timeshift channel launched in September 2007, replacing Toon Disney.{{cite news|url=http://www.boursier.com/vals/FR/canalsat-lancera-une-nouvelle-chaine-disney-a-la-rentree-news-236227.htm|title=CanalSat : lancera une nouvelle chaÃ®ne Disney Ã  la rentrÃ©e|publisher=Boursier.com|accessdate=2007-06-17|date=2007-05-29}} On April 1, 2011, '''Disney Channel''' is launched on the adsl ( [[Freebox]] ; [[SFR | Neufbox]] ; [[Orange (telecommunications) | Livebox]] ; [[Bouygues Telecom | Bbox]] ). On April 19, 2011, Disney and Free launched a VoD system on [[Freebox]] called Disneytekhttp://www.universfreebox.com/article13853.html In addition to the animated programmes, the French Disney Channel used to feature a show with human hosts called ''[[Zapping Zone]]''. It was cancelled in 2004. ==Programmes== Programmes currently shown on Disney Channel *''[[Phineas and Ferb]]'' *''[[Kim Possible]]'' *''[[Good Luck Charlie]]'' *''[[Fish Hooks]]'' *''[[Sonny With A Chance]]'' *''[[I'm in the Band]]'' *''[[Shake It Up (TV series)|Shake It Up]]'' *''[[Hannah Montana]] *''[[Wizards of Waverly Place]]'' *''[[The Suite Life on Deck]] *''[[Sabrina's Secret Life]] *[[A Kind of Magic (TV series)|A Kind Of Magic]] * ''[[A.N.T. Farm]]''http://www.disneychannelmedianet.com/DNR/2010/doc/dc_af_111110.doc Disney Channel France is also shown in other French-speaking countries in Europe and Africa as well. ==Upcoming Series== * ''Madison High''http://www.deadline.com/2010/11/disney-channel-preps-first-musical-series/#more-83717 * ''Austin and Ally''http://disneyinfonet.com/2010/12/08/disney-channel-orders-pilot-for-new-show/ * ''Lights, Camera, Muppets!'' {{citation needed|date=December 2010}} * ''Gravity Falls''http://www.disneychannelmedianet.com/DNR/2010/doc/dc_new_120810.doc ==Logos== When launched in 1997, Disney Channel France adopted the same logo and idents as Disney Channel UK. It adopted a new identity package by Gedeon in March 1999. In June 21, 2003, Disney Channel France also adopted Disney Channel US' new logo and idents. In 2011, Disney Channel International new logo and idents. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.disneychannel.fr/ Official site] *[http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cI2YgUSxpRI&feature=related Disney Channel France ident in 2001] {{Disney Channel}} {{French television stations}} [[Category:French television networks]] [[Category:Disney Channel]] [[Category:Children's television networks]] [[da:Disney Channel (Frankrig)]] [[es:Disney Channel (Francia)]] [[fr:Disney Channel France]] [[id:Disney Channel France]] [[nn:Disney Channel Frankrike]] [[pl:Disney Channel (Francja)]]
